DataElement.preferredName: Patient Therapeutic Procedure Complication Related Hospitalization Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A yes/no/unknown response to indicate whether the patient was hospitalized for a treatment-related complication.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Therapeutic Procedure Complication Related Hospitalization
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._The condition of being treated as a patient in a hospital._Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure._A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something._The condition of being treated as a patient in a hospital.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure.:A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.:The condition of being treated as a patient in a hospital.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure.
A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.
The condition of being treated as a patient in a hospital.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 7/31/17 jk DEC versioned for property CUI change per Vanita/NRG; transferred Context, added CSI and reg status per Round 5 finalization task

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.
